newsitem.title: GERMANY: RWE expects higher telecoms losses in 96/97.
newsitem.headline: RWE expects higher telecoms losses in 96/97.

text.p: German diversified utility RWE AG expects higher losses in its fledgling telecommunications business in the current business year, the company said on Tuesday.
Start-up losses had been factored in to the group's strategy and would be higher in the 1996/1997 year, RWE said in a statement prepared for delivery at a news conference.
In the 1995/96 business year, the group saw turnover in its telecoms business of around 500 million marks, with losses of 75 million marks in the period.

RWE took the markets by surprise earlier this month when it said it was pulling out of a German telecoms alliance with British Telecom and fellow diversified utility Viag AG due to differences over market strategy.
The group said it would instead join an alliance between the British group Cable & Wireless and the third of the big German utility groups, Veba AG.
